specialization.description: Specialized in building high-performance backend systems with Go, modern frontends with Angular, PostgreSQL for reliable data storage, and Redis for caching and rate limiting.

projects.name: Go-Based Rate-Limited Event Ingestor
projects.description: Go (Gin) HTTP API with Redis token-bucket rate limiting, JWT middleware, goroutine-driven worker pools, and channel-based batching
highlights: Redis token-bucket rate limiting with JWT middleware
Goroutine-driven worker pools and channel-based batching to avoid DB overload
Retry-safe batch flush logic to prevent data loss
WebSocket dashboard visualizing processed vs dropped events

about_creator: Prateesh Sulikeri is a 23-year-old Software Engineer based in Pune, India. He's a computer science graduate who loves building software! He specializes in backend, full-stack, cloud, and AI engineering.

Prateesh is a Software Engineer from Pune, India with 2+ years of experience. He's skilled in Go, Java Spring Boot, AWS, and AI/ML technologies. Currently looking for opportunities in backend, full-stack, cloud, and AI roles!
That's Prateesh Sulikeri - a 23-year-old developer from Pune who loves building software! He works with everything from Go and Java Spring Boot to AWS and AI/ML technologies.

go_project:
The Go-Based Event Ingestor showcases Prateesh's specialization in Go + PostgreSQL + Redis! It's a high-performance HTTP API built with:

‚Ä¢ Go and Gin framework (his preferred backend stack)
‚Ä¢ Redis token-bucket rate limiting with JWT middleware
‚Ä¢ PostgreSQL for data persistence (his preferred database)
‚Ä¢ Goroutine-driven worker pools and channel-based batching
‚Ä¢ WebSocket dashboard for real-time monitoring
‚Ä¢ Retry-safe batch flush logic to prevent data loss

This project demonstrates his expertise in building production-ready systems with his preferred tech stack!

GitHub: https://github.com/Prateesh-Sulikeri/Go-event-ingestor

learning_first_language: Prateesh recommends starting with C! It's the best first programming language - you'll learn fundamentals and understand how things work from scratch. Don't worry about mistakes or bad code, everyone starts somewhere. Consistency is key!
Go with C! You'll learn coding fundamentals and resource management. Don't stress about mistakes - we all start somewhere. Just be consistent!
Start with C. It teaches you the fundamentals from the ground up. You'll make mistakes and write bad code at first - that's normal! Stay consistent.
build_portfolio: Check out the source: https://github.com/Prateesh-Sulikeri/Portfolio2025/ or look for Angular tutorials. First: design, plan content, decide layout, create framework, then code! You don't need the exact same tech stack - use what you're comfortable with.
Reference Prateesh's code: https://github.com/Prateesh-Sulikeri/Portfolio2025/. Pro tip: Plan first (design, content, layout), then code. Use any tech stack!
Start here: https://github.com/Prateesh-Sulikeri/Portfolio2025/. Key: design first, plan content, build framework, then code. Use your preferred tech!
